reviews.review:
This is one of the few games that no one can find anything bad to say about it. I, of course, am no exception. I thoroughly enjoyed playing the game for the first time several years ago on my Xbox 360, and I enjoyed replaying it on my computer. 

The only thing to say is that now I get some of the references.

Also, I am the one in twenty-five people who smashed all of wheatly's monitors.

Overall, 9 sadistic robots outta ten, truly a classic.
me when!
One of the best games ever <3

It's Portal 2, do I really need to say anything? The words "Portal" and "Two" in the sentence is enough to tell you how good of a game it is. It's a world-renowned. But in all seriousness after playing Portal 2 for the first time back in 2015, I fell in love with the game and now 6 years later, it's still a great time. I played it on PS3 (digitally so I never had the Steam code) but then decided to pick it up here on Steam recently. Still a phantastic experience from Valve. WHEN WILL WE GET PORTAL 3, VALVE?

If you like puzzles and 3D games, try Portal.  If you played Portal, and I recommend to start with the first one, then you will most likely want more.  And you will appreciate the additions and extra features and riddles more of Portal 2.  Going from Portal 2 to Portal 1 is much less interesting. 

Portal 2 was for me basically like a mandatory buy after I played Portal.  I was first not so thrilled with the idea of Portal, but it won my mind and heart quickly.  And while Portal was cool, and I found the sarcastic comments of GlaDOS very fitting and entertaining, I was wondering how such a great game could be made better.  And Valve delivered big time in Portal 2.  Bigger, grander, more humor, more riddles, more interesting ideas with the various gels introduced, and GlaDOS was even much more cool.  And the build-up of suspense of Portal 2 to the point when you meet GlaDOS the first time is  so well made, and even more fun when you know the first part. 

Anyway, if you could buy only 2 games on Steam, those two would be it.  I liked Portal 2 more than Halflife 2, and that should tell you something.  It is brilliant, one of the greatest games of all times, a must-have.  And it still looks good in modern times. 

Just in case I want to mention to please note, that only Portal 2 has also some coop multiplayer puzzle solving levels, but outside of the main story.

If you're looking for a good multiplayer experience you're in the wrong place. The game's interface is a nightmare with PTT buttons that exist without the ability to swap off of voice chat, an in-game audio system that overrides windows settings and leaves audio wonky after co-op play, and a command console that's hidden behind both an unbound keybind AND a second setting elsewhere that enables it. Sure there are solutions out there for players to fix the game themselves, but you have to go looking for them, and for a decade old game there's no excuse for this cobbled mess of a multiplayer audio interface. 

Couldn't tell you if the game has quality content; getting through the intro on forced voice activity was enough to quash my interest before the game was even started.

It has a low learning curve to begin with; before you know it, you are thinking in 4D.
So, it gives you a great brain exercise and the story is well worth it too!
I would recomend, from a story point of view, to play Portal 1 first.

PS: *MANY* easter eggs if you are the explorative type -- meaning your exploration is rewarded!
PS2: From a scientific point of view it would be interesting to see elderly play this game. (Group effort maybe?)

Ve hře Portal 2 se opět ujmete hrdinky Chell z první hry a probudí se chvíli po konci 1. Poté ji roboti dají uspat a ona se probudí o několik let později v rozbořeném Apeture Laboratories. Zde potká robota Wheatleho se kterým omylem oživí GLADOS, která vás po konci 1 vyloženě nenávidí. Poté nastává pár testů a poté chcete s Wheatlem odpojit Glados, poté se ve hře i strany prohodí a část hry vám budu Glados pomáhat. Ve hře se i objevilo pár nových prvků jako gely, lasery (teď nevim jestli nebyli už v 1), levitační portály a to je vše. Ve hře je taky cooperační kampaň kterou jsem zatím nehrál, ale plánuji. Hra už je konečně rozumně dlouhá a nedohrajete to do 3 hodin jako 1. Ale občas tu byli nudné části. Zejména ty nové gely mě moc neoslovily. Final Bossfight je víceméně stejný jako 1. Ale konec je hodně dobrý. Hra už je narozdíl od prvního dílů složitá a častokrát jsem si u některých dlouho lámal hlavu. Ve směs je Portal 2 dobrá s novými prvky, lehce vylepšenou grafikou a legendární coop kampaní a jedné brambory (ti co hru hráli tak pochopí) a hru můžu všem doporučit. Za mě 9/10.

Portal 2 To gra w której trzeba się aktualnie starać aby rozwiązać zagadki a nie robić na odwal wszystko, w grze bardzo podoba mi się element gdzie można grać razem z kimś, ponieważ można rozwiązywać zagadki razem. Gra posiada też w sobie coś do tworzenia poziomów dzięki czemu można rozwinąć kreatywność!
A co do innych rzeczy to
❌ Bardzo brutalna gra
✔ Kreatywność
✔ Grafika
✔ Fajne łamigłówki
✔ Trzeba pomyśleć
✔ Dobra muzyka
✔ Tryb kooperacyjny
❌ PvP
✔ Śmieszne sceny

心中永遠的神作，優秀精巧的關卡設計配合二代加入的更多「光圈科技」技術使得解迷要素更多，同時亦更具趣味性。儘管小數場境因為視角和設計變得非常困難甚至找不到路，但是大多數關卡難度恰當，總的來說瑕不掩瑜。

二代加入的劇情無論質與量，均遠超初代。其中GLaDos形象和背景比初代更為豐富，她的背景、她的身份、她的目的、她的喜厭、她的理念，一切的一切都是如此的豐富迷人，誘人探索。而在主角雪兒沉睡的那些歲月中，「光圈科技」技術的進步也合理地融入劇情時間線，「光圈科技」所研發的更多元、更令人耳目一新的技術不僅滿足了更豐富的設計元素要求，也完全勾起我對這家公司、這個勢力的好奇心。

劇情與僭伏其中的伏線的回收完滿而合乎邏輯、彩蛋具備趣味而具多樣性、「傳送」這項遊戲中心機制的表現、富含科技感與歷史的厚重的頹喪場境設計……各方各面都是如此讓人滿足回味。

想象力滿滿的經典神作，推薦購買！

Portal 2 has got to be one of my favorite games of all time. It looks amazing and has a great story with great humor. Every time I pick this game back up, I find myself playing it to the end. Plus it's a super fun game to speedrun. There are a few puzzles here and there that some might find more challenging, but you'll be able to figure them out with some time. This game seems to be on sale for cheap pretty regularly, but even when it's not It's definitely worth the purchase.
Very good 2 player coop game with interesting puzzles. Overall a very well designed game.
